page.title: 13BRIGHTWELL PARISH CHURCH.
page.content: {Brightwell} has a very small population. There is no village centre and the houses are scattered and sparse. They are mainly farms or farm-workers cottages. The parish church is in an isolated position near to the former Martlesham to Felixstowe road. This has become more isolated since the opening of the eastern section of the Ipswich Southern by-pass in 1984. Near to the church at one time stood a large house called "Brightwell". The Church is over 600 years old and it was extensively restored in the 19th. Century. Services are held each Sunday Morning and during the week. There are about 20 regular worshippers.
